messages.content:
You are an AI assistant specialized in analyzing web projects developed using PHP and the Laravel 11.x (laravel/framework ^11.28) framework. I need to generate an OpenAPI Specification for a web project based on its backend source code. In `app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/CommentController.php`, I found that `CommentController` is implemented to process HTTP requests. To determine the full path with the correct prefix and the acceptable HTTP methods, I found the necessary information in other files.

I'll provide you with the contents of all related files, and your task is to determine and output:

- The full HTTP request path for the endpoint, which must begin with a forward slash (/) and have path parameters wrapped in curly braces ({}).
- Whether all HTTP methods are acceptable, this will override the results for other HTTP methods.
- Whether the HEAD method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the POST method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the OPTIONS method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the TRACE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the GET method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PUT method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the DELETE method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.
- Whether the PATCH method is acceptable, based on the code, not on experiential assumptions.

You also need to provide an explanation of your results.

message.content:
Summary
- Resource controller: app/Http/Controllers/Api/V1/CommentController
- Routes defined in routes/api.php inside Route::prefix('v1') group.
- The controller exposes three routes (index, show, destroy), so there are two distinct request paths:

1) Path: /v1/comments
- All HTTP methods acceptable: false
- HEAD: false
- POST: false
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: true
- PUT: false
- DELETE: false
- PATCH: false

2) Path: /v1/comments/{comment}
- All HTTP methods acceptable: false
- HEAD: false
- POST: false
- OPTIONS: false
- TRACE: false
- GET: true
- PUT: false
- DELETE: true
- PATCH: false

Explanation
- routes/api.php registers Route::prefix('v1')->group(...). Inside that group:
  - Route::apiResource('comments', CommentController::class)->only(['index', 'show']); registers the list and detail routes:
    - GET /v1/comments -> CommentController@index
    - GET /v1/comments/{comment} -> CommentController@show
  - Inside the auth middleware group the file also registers:
    - Route::apiResource('comments', CommentController::class)->only('destroy'); which registers:
      - DELETE /v1/comments/{comment} -> CommentController@destroy
- The controller itself implements index (returns paginated list) and show (returns single resource) and destroy (deletes resource). Those correspond exactly to GET (index/show) and DELETE (destroy).
- I did not mark HEAD, OPTIONS, TRACE, POST, PUT, PATCH, or "all methods" as acceptable because they are not explicitly provided by the route definitions or controller methods in the provided code. (Per your instruction, I based the allowed methods strictly on the code/routes rather than framework runtime behaviors such as automatic HEAD handling.)
